topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.0: Changing the NTP Server Configuration

body.p: You can change the NTP server addresses defined for the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade at any time after installation. During software installation, you configured the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade with NTP server IP addresses. You change these addresses using the web administration interface or the CLI.
body.note: This feature applies only to KVM region servers.
body.p: Before changing NTP server addresses, review the Fault Management page and make sure that any existing system alarms are cleared.
Caution: For the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade system to use FQDN servers instead of IPv4 servers, at least one valid DNS server must be specified.

ol.li: Launch the HP Helion OpenStack Horizon Dashboard.

Select the appropriate region and project.
For Denver and Tahoe deployments,you can work only in regionone
Click the Admin dashboard, then the System Configuration panel.

Click the NTP tab.
The NTP page displays the currently defined NTP servers and their IP addresses.

In the Edit NTP dialog box, replace the NTP server address(es) with different ones as required.
If you specify the NTP servers using FQDNs you must have at least one valid DNS server defined on your system. You must use IP addresses otherwise.

body.p: Changing this IP raises major alarms against the controllers and services. You can view the alarms on the Fault Management page.
Changing the OAM IP causes major alarms against the controllers and services.
Use the Hosts table to determine which hosts requiring attention (indicated with the status Config out-of-date). Perform the following steps to lock and unlock the controllers to clear the alarms:

ol.li: Click the Admin dashboard, then the System panel, then the Inventory tab. Click the Hosts table.
Lock the standby controller. Wait for the lock operation to be completed.
Unlock the standby controller. Wait for the host to become available. It is updated with the new NTP server addresses, and its error message is cleared.

Perform a swact on the active controller. After the swact, the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade begins using the new OAM network configuration. If you have changed the OAM subnet or the OAM floating IP address, the current web session is terminated. To continue using the web administration interface, you must start a new session and log in using the new IP address. You may also need to update router tables to establish a connection.

Lock the original controller (now in standby mode). Wait for the lock operation to be completed. e) Unlock the original controller. It is updated with the new NTP server addresses, and its error message is cleared.
Lock and unlock each compute node.

body.p: For more information on system configuration, see the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.0: Administrator Guide.
